column4: hi. i have a problem the terminal bell not ringing  .... echo -e '\a'  and stuff ... no sound .... any idea?
do you have any sound at all? ;>
yes ... mp3, movies ... sound is fine
good question ... i have to find out exactly what kind of terminal it is
its a gnome-terminal and i activated Terminal Bell in the settings
still no beep after "xset b on"
try running "xrdb -query" and see if the config might tell you something
speaker in alsamixer is set to "0"
i guess ... but i cant change the value .... where can i change it?
in alsamixer i unmuted 'Beep' and raised the dB ... 'Speaker' dB cant be changed .... still no BEEP after all
if you are running it on xterm, shouldn't it use your audio device for playing the beep though?
good point ... it beeps like a charme on the real terminal Ctrl-alt-F1
did you check the mixer control on the desktop? maybe xterm isn't set to use any sound card
where do i find this setting ... is it in the preferences?
I'm using xfce myself, so I wouldn't know exactly where on regular ubuntu :<
